Our military readiness levels when I came to Congress in 2017 were the worst since 1977. That is unacceptable, but I am encouraged by the last two defense bills. We are digging ourselves out of this hole, but it will not happen overnight.
As a nation, we just passed over $22 trillion in debt. We don't have a revenue problem, we have a spending problem. We cannot ignore this any longer.
Prescription drug pricing is an issue with bipartisan support to fix. We must fix this now and lower costs.
One of the most critical issues we must address is health care. We need to lower costs, protect those with pre-existing conditions, and target taxpayer money to go where it can be most effective.
We need to secure our border. Border security is national security.

I voted on two bills last summer that would have funded a targeted wall, and address a plan forward for DACA. There has to be some give and take from both sides to advance on this issue for our country.

The statements from the VA Governor about abortion were terrible. We are 1 of 7 countries in the world that allow abortions past 20 weeks. I am a cosponsor of the Pain Capable Unborn Child Protection Act to change this.
We need more Holocaust education to combat anti-semitism, and I am committed to furthering Holocaust education in our country.
Anti-Semitism is increasing. We have to be honest about it, that it comes from the right and left. This is unacceptable and repugnant and there is no tolerance for it.
Of all the issues we work with in Congress, veterans issues have the most bipartisan support.
A shutdown is a sign of a non-functioning government. We have to do better.
Great news for NE as the Air Force has committed to replacing the entire Offutt runway. I was glad to work with the NE delegation on this.
This is our 11th townhall, eight in person and now three over the telephone. We appreciate all those who are attending!
I passed four bills last Congress, and have already passed one this Congress. To be productive, we need to find areas where we agree on.
I have been reading details of the Green New Deal, and think it would be a terrible bill as it is now written. Among other things, this would be disastrous for our beef industry.
